document_metadata.title: Occupational Safety and Health Standards - Subpart L Fire Protection
document_metadata.authority: Occupational Safety and Health Administration, Department of Labor

content.title: After-flame
content.text: After-flame means the time a test specimen continues to flame after the flame source has been removed.
content.summary: Duration that material continues burning after ignition source is removed

content.title: Education
content.text: Education means the process of imparting knowledge or skill through systematic instruction. It does not require formal classroom instruction.
content.summary: Knowledge transfer through systematic instruction, including non-classroom methods

content.title: Fire brigade
content.text: Fire brigade (private fire department, industrial fire department) means an organized group of employees who are knowledgeable, trained, and skilled in at least basic fire fighting operations.
content.summary: Organized employee group trained in basic firefighting operations

content.title: Training
content.text: Training means the process of making proficient through instruction and hands-on practice in the operation of equipment, including respiratory protection equipment, that is expected to be used and in the performance of assigned duties.
content.summary: Process of developing proficiency through instruction and hands-on practice

content.title: Fire Brigade Training and Education
content.text: The employer shall provide training and education for all fire brigade members commensurate with those duties and functions that fire brigade members are expected to perform. Such training and education shall be provided to fire brigade members before they perform fire brigade emergency activities. Fire brigade leaders and training instructors shall be provided with training and education which is more comprehensive than that provided to the general membership of the fire brigade.
content.summary: Mandatory training for all fire brigade members before emergency activities, with enhanced training for leaders and instructors

training_details.frequency: Before emergency activities and at least annually
training_details.scope: Commensurate with duties and functions expected to be performed
training_details.trainer_requirements: Fire brigade leaders and training instructors require more comprehensive training
training_details.quality_benchmark: Similar to training conducted by fire training schools
example_institutions: New York State Department Fire Prevention and Control
Louisiana State University Firemen Training Program
Washington State's Fire Service Training Commission
training_details.industry_specific: For oil refinery industry: Texas A & M University, Lamar University, Reno Fire School, Delaware State Fire School
training_details.trigger: Before performing fire brigade emergency activities
training_details.performance_standard: Members must be able to perform assigned duties satisfactorily and safely

procedure_steps: Identify duties and functions expected of fire brigade members
Ensure training occurs before emergency activities
Provide enhanced training for leaders and instructors

content.title: Fire Brigade Training Frequency
content.text: The employer shall assure that training and education is conducted frequently enough to assure that each member of the fire brigade is able to perform the member's assigned duties and functions satisfactorily and in a safe manner so as not to endanger fire brigade members or other employees. All fire brigade members shall be provided with training at least annually. In addition, fire brigade members who are expected to perform interior structural fire fighting shall be provided with an education session or training at least quarterly.
content.summary: Annual training for all members, quarterly for interior structural firefighters

training_details.frequency: At least annually for all members; at least quarterly for interior structural firefighting
training_details.scope: Assigned duties and functions performed safely
training_details.audience: All fire brigade members, with special requirements for interior structural firefighters
training_details.quality_benchmark: Satisfactory and safe performance of assigned duties
training_details.performance_standard: Safe performance without endangering members or other employees

procedure_steps: Assess member competency in assigned duties
Provide annual training for all members
Provide quarterly training for interior structural firefighters
Ensure safe performance standards are met

content.title: Portable Fire Extinguisher Education
content.text: Where the employer has provided portable fire extinguishers for employee use in the workplace, the employer shall also provide an educational program to familiarize employees with the general principles of fire extinguisher use and the hazards involved with incipient stage fire fighting.
content.summary: Educational program required when portable extinguishers are provided for employee use

training_details.frequency: Upon initial employment and at least annually thereafter
training_details.scope: General principles of fire extinguisher use and hazards of incipient stage fire fighting
training_details.audience: Employees who have access to portable fire extinguishers
training_details.trigger: When portable fire extinguishers are provided for employee use
training_details.performance_standard: Understanding of general principles and hazards

procedure_steps: Provide educational program covering general principles
Cover hazards of incipient stage fire fighting

content.title: Designated Employee Fire Equipment Training
content.text: The employer shall provide employees who have been designated to use fire fighting equipment as part of an emergency action plan with training in the use of the appropriate equipment.
content.summary: Specific training required for employees designated to use firefighting equipment

training_details.frequency: Upon initial assignment and at least annually thereafter
training_details.scope: Use of appropriate fire fighting equipment
training_details.audience: Employees designated to use fire fighting equipment in emergency action plan
training_details.trigger: When employees are designated for fire fighting equipment use

content.title: Fixed Extinguishing System Training
content.text: The employer shall train employees designated to inspect, maintain, operate, or repair fixed extinguishing systems and annually review their training to keep them up-to-date in the functions they are to perform.
content.summary: Training and annual review for employees working with fixed extinguishing systems

training_details.scope: Inspection, maintenance, operation, or repair of fixed extinguishing systems
training_details.audience: Employees designated for fixed system work
training_details.quality_benchmark: Up-to-date in functions to be performed
training_details.trigger: When employees are designated for fixed system work

procedure_steps: Provide initial training for designated employees

content.title: Fire Brigade Organizational Statement
content.text: The employer shall prepare and maintain a statement or written policy which establishes the existence of a fire brigade; the basic organizational structure; the type, amount, and frequency of training to be provided to fire brigade members; the expected number of members in the fire brigade; and the functions that the fire brigade is to perform at the workplace. The organizational statement shall be available for inspection by the Assistant Secretary and by employees or their designated representatives.
content.summary: Written policy establishing fire brigade organization, training, and functions

procedure_steps: Specify training type, amount, and frequency
Make available for inspection by Assistant Secretary
Make available for inspection by employees or representatives
required_elements: Written statement establishing fire brigade existence

content.title: Portable Fire Extinguisher Inspection Responsibility
content.text: The employer shall be responsible for the inspection, maintenance and testing of all portable fire extinguishers in the workplace.
content.summary: Employer responsibility for all portable fire extinguisher maintenance activities

content.title: NFPA Protective Clothing Standard
content.text: The performance, construction, and testing of fire-resistive coats and protective trousers shall be at least equivalent to the requirements of the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) standard NFPA No. 1971-1975, "Protective Clothing for Structural Fire Fighting," which is incorporated by reference as specified in § 1910.6.
content.summary: NFPA 1971-1975 standard incorporated for protective clothing requirements

reference_details.title: Protective Clothing for Structural Fire Fighting
reference_details.purpose: Performance, construction, and testing requirements for fire-resistive coats and protective trousers
reference_details.publication_title: Protective Clothing for Structural Fire Fighting

content.title: NIOSH Fire Fighter Glove Criteria
content.text: Gloves or glove system shall be tested in accordance with the test methods contained in the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH) 1976 publication, "The Development of Criteria for Fire Fighter's Gloves; Vol. II, Part II: Test Methods," which is incorporated by reference as specified in § 1910.6.
content.summary: NIOSH 1976 publication incorporated for glove testing methods

reference_details.title: The Development of Criteria for Fire Fighter's Gloves; Vol. II, Part II: Test Methods
reference_details.organization: National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH)
reference_details.purpose: Test methods for fire fighter gloves and glove systems
reference_details.publication_title: The Development of Criteria for Fire Fighter's Gloves

content.title: Fire Protection Guidance
content.text: This appendix contains nonmandatory guidelines to assist employers in complying with the appropriate requirements of subpart L, including guidance on fire brigade organization, training, protective clothing, and respiratory protection.
content.summary: Nonmandatory guidance for fire protection compliance including detailed recommendations for fire brigade operations

appendix_details.purpose: Assist employers in complying with subpart L requirements
appendix_details.scope: Fire brigade organization, training, protective clothing, respiratory protection

content.title: Test Methods for Protective Clothing
content.text: This appendix contains test methods which must be used to determine if protective clothing affords the required level of protection as specified in § 1910.156, fire brigades.
content.summary: Mandatory test methods for verifying protective clothing meets required protection levels

appendix_details.purpose: Determine if protective clothing meets required protection levels
appendix_details.scope: Test methods for protective clothing verification
content_areas: Puncture resistance test for foot protection
appendix_details.coverage: Complete testing protocols for protective clothing
